result.execSummary:
The defendant Terry S. Christopher was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Terry S. Christopher is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Terry S. Christopher was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Terry S. Christopher

records.addlTxt:
11:03 AM Defendant Terry S. Christopher appeared by video.  Attorney Christopher Michael Restemayer appeared by video for Terry S. Christopher.  Attorney Karl J. Kelz in court for State of Wisconsin. DA Kelz states the parties have reached an agreement and recites the agreement on record. Defendant freely, voluntarily, and intelligently waives his right to be personally present in the courtroom. Contingent upon the defendant's plea to Ct. 2 the State will move to dismiss Ct. 1. Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY to Ct. 2 therefore Ct.1 is DISMISSED. Court questions DE regarding the plea. DA explains elements of charge.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty and orders entry of JOC. Comments by parties. 
Ct. 1- Dismissed  
Ct. 2- 
$400 Fine 
$200 DNA + Sample
Defendant is given 1 day credit

Monetary Obligations: $100/mo starting on or before 10/8/2022 or one day in jail for every $25.00 then owing, until paid in full. 


Appeal Rights Given
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 27, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Status hearing on November 28, 2022 at 11:30 am.

10:31 AM Defendant Terry S. Christopher appeared by phone.  Attorney Karl J. Kelz in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant states he has not received the criminal complaint. Court goes over the charges and maximum penalties. Complaint acknowledged, reading waived. Notice of right to attorney given to Defendant. DA Kelz gives bond recommendations. Bond ordered as requested. Defendant questions the court on preliminary hearing. Court gives responses and explanations. Preliminary hearing requested, time limits waived. Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled for 08/18/2022 at 2:15 PM. Defendant updates address on record.
State's demand for discovery and notice of intent to use DNA evidence

records.addlTxt:
2:31PM DEF Terry Christopher appeared via video from in custody from Price County Jail.  Atty K. Kelz appeared in person for the State of WI.  Court calls case, recites appearances, and possible charges stated.  Court gives DEF notice of right to attorney.  Court questions parties as to bond.   State makes bond recommendation.  No objections. Court orders bond.  Court sets INIT for 7/5/22 at 10AM.  

COURT:  SIBS $1500
